title: Establishing the White House Task Force on the FIFA World Cup 2026
summary:
The document outlines Executive Order 14234, issued on March 7, 2025, which establishes the White House Task Force on the FIFA World Cup 2026. This initiative aims to prepare for the World Cup, marking a significant event coinciding with the 250th anniversary of the United States. The Task Force, chaired by the President and vice-chaired by the Vice President, will coordinate efforts across various government departments to facilitate planning, organization, and execution of the World Cup events. 

Key members include the Secretaries of State, Treasury, Defense, and other relevant officials, with the Department of Homeland Security providing administrative support. The Task Force is tasked with reporting on their planning activities by June 1, 2025, and is set to disband on December 31, 2026, unless extended. The order emphasizes collaboration among agencies while clarifying that it does not create enforceable rights or benefits. 

Overall, the establishment of this Task Force highlights the U.S. government's commitment to leveraging the World Cup for national pride, economic growth, and tourism.
